item.description: Image: Geometric Interactive/Annapurna Interactive You might have walked right past it Cocoon is the puzzle aficionado‚Äôs delight. The isometric adventure from Geometric Interactive marries pared-dow...
item.content:encoded: Image: Geometric Interactive/Annapurna Interactive You might have walked right past it Cocoon is the puzzle aficionado‚Äôs delight. The isometric adventure from Geometric Interactive marries pared-down gameplay with a mind-bending premise where players jump between worlds nestled inside of orbs. Polygon spoke to designer and director Jeppe Carlsen about the making of this world‚Äôs curious puzzles. In that conversation, he revealed that for Cocoon, making the hard-to-beat puzzles came easily. Maki...

item.description: Image: Arkane Studios/Bethesda Softworks Locked at 30 fps no more Five months after its launch on PC and Xbox, Arkane Studios‚Äô Redfall has received the performance mode patch that enables 60 fps sup...
item.content:encoded: Image: Arkane Studios/Bethesda Softworks Locked at 30 fps no more Five months after its launch on PC and Xbox, Arkane Studios‚Äô Redfall has received the performance mode patch that enables 60 fps support on Xbox Series X and S consoles. Performance mode for Redfall arrives as part of game update 2 for Arkane‚Äôs vampire-infested first-person shooter ‚Äî an update that also includes new stealth takedowns, accessibility improvements, and ‚Äúan even more dangerous Redfall with an increased open world en...

item.title: More game studios are changing the industry by unionizing | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Photo: Emanuele Cremaschi/Getty Images Union interest continues to grow The game industry is changing. After years of groundwork over the past decade, laid over social media and in the halls of gath...
item.content:encoded: Photo: Emanuele Cremaschi/Getty Images Union interest continues to grow The game industry is changing. After years of groundwork over the past decade, laid over social media and in the halls of gatherings like the Game Developers Conference, workers are organizing into unions in their fight against a history of overwork, low pay, and harassment. Unions are on the rise in the game industry as workers seek to make meaningful, sustainable change. Industry change is following a nationwide trend in...

item.content:encoded: Image: Larian Studios via Polygon A Tav by any other name A funny story about me: I did not know that ‚ÄúTav‚Äù was the default name for the player character in Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3. I thought, like in other role-playing games I‚Äôve played, it was a randomly generated name. ‚ÄúTav,‚Äù I thought when I saw it, ‚Äúnot bad for a random name generator.‚Äù Then I found out lots of other people have Tavs, and learned the truth: I wasn‚Äôt impressed by a random selection; I had settled for vanilla. Mortifying, honestly....

item.content:encoded: Image: Tango Gameworks/Bethesda Softworks Get Ghostwire: Tokyo with an Amazon Prime sub 2022 was a great year for video game releases ‚Äî so great, in fact, that a game like Ghostwire: Tokyo, an altogether good game brimming with character and compelling ideas, may have been relegated to many players‚Äô backlogs. I know that was the case for me. However, I spent much of the 2022 holiday season exploring Tango Gameworks‚Äô ghost-infested facsimile of Japan‚Äôs bustling metropolis, and I had a blast. An...

item.content:encoded: Image: CD Projekt Red Patch 2.0 is a testament to the strength of CDPR‚Äôs original vision It wasn‚Äôt long into Microsoft‚Äôs E3 2019 press conference that Cyberpunk 2077 was showcased alongside the famously ‚Äúbreathtaking‚Äù Keanu Reeves. item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo You can pick up the $349.99 red OLED Switch from multiple retailers starting today Wa-hoo! To celebrate the upcoming launch of Super Mario Bros. Wonder, you can currently purchase a Nintendo Switch modeled after everyone's favorite red plumber on the Nintendo Store, Amazon, Target, and Best Buy for $349.99. The new edition of the console costs the same as the standard version of the stock OLED Switch, and features all of the same hardware, including an improved display, kicks...

item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo A sweet design, plus it includes Animal Crossing: New Horizons for no extra charge Nintendo is gearing up for the holidays with some fresh Switch console bundles. This year brings a new $199.99 Switch Lite bundle that‚Äôs Animal Crossing-themed. It comes in light pink or blue, with leaves printed on the console. item.description: Posted by Carlos Esteves and Ameesh Makadia, Research Scientists, Google Research, Athena Team Typical deep learning models for computer vision, like convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and visio...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Carlos Esteves and Ameesh Makadia, Research Scientists, Google Research, Athena Team Typical deep learning models for computer vision, like convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and vision transformers (ViT), process signals assuming planar (flat) spaces. For example, digital images are represented as a grid of pixels on a plane. However, this type of data makes up only a fraction of the data we encounter in scientific applications. Variables sampled from the Earth's atmosphere, lik...

item.title: Scaling up learning across many different robot types | DeepMind Blog
item.description: We are launching a new set of resources for general-purpose robotics learning across different robot types, or embodiments. Together with partners from 34 academic labs we have pooled data from 22 dif...
item.content:encoded: We are launching a new set of resources for general-purpose robotics learning across different robot types, or embodiments. Together with partners from 34 academic labs we have pooled data from 22 different robot types to create the Open X-Embodiment dataset. We also release RT-1-X, a robotics transformer (RT) model derived from RT-1 and trained on our dataset, that shows skills transfer across many robot embodiments.

item.title: DynIBaR: Space-time view synthesis from videos of dynamic scenes | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Zhengqi Li and Noah Snavely, Research Scientists, Google Research A mobile phone‚Äôs camera is a powerful tool for capturing everyday moments. However, capturing a dynamic scene using a...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Zhengqi Li and Noah Snavely, Research Scientists, Google Research A mobile phone‚Äôs camera is a powerful tool for capturing everyday moments. However, capturing a dynamic scene using a single camera is fundamentally limited. For instance, if we wanted to adjust the camera motion or timing of a recorded video (e.g., to freeze time while sweeping the camera around to highlight a dramatic moment), we would typically need an expensive Hollywood setup with a synchronized camera rig. W...

item.title: Re-weighted gradient descent via distributionally robust optimization | Google AI Blog
item.description: Ramnath Kumar, Pre-Doctoral Researcher, and Arun Sai Suggala, Research Scientist, Google Research Deep neural networks (DNNs) have become essential for solving a wide range of tasks, from standar...
item.content:encoded: Ramnath Kumar, Pre-Doctoral Researcher, and Arun Sai Suggala, Research Scientist, Google Research Deep neural networks (DNNs) have become essential for solving a wide range of tasks, from standard supervised learning (image classification using ViT) to meta-learning. The most commonly-used paradigm for learning DNNs is empirical risk minimization (ERM), which aims to identify a network that minimizes the average loss on training data points. Several algorithms, including stochastic gradient...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Micha≈Ç Januszewski, Research Scientist, Google Research The human brain is perhaps the most computationally complex machine in existence, consisting of networks of billions of cells. Researchers currently don‚Äôt understand the full picture of how glitches in its network machinery contribute to mental illnesses and other diseases, such as dementia. However, the emerging connectomics field, which aims to precisely map the connections between every cell in the brain, could help solve...
